programme.title: Scoreline: Soccer Highlights & Analysis
programme.desc: The biggest news impacting global football, and match highlights.

programme.title: CBS Sports Golazo Matchnight
programme.desc: CBS SPORTS GOLAZO NETWORK is a first-of-its-kind free, 24-hour channel in the U.S.dedicated exclusively to global soccer coverage. CBS SPORTS GOLAZO NETWORK, with its unparalleled coverage of all the top domestic and international soccer competitions across the globe, is the ultimate year-round streaming destination for soccer fans. CBS SPORTS GOLAZO NETWORK is anchored weekdays from 7:00-9:00 AM, ET, by - MORNING FOOTY, the Network’s flagship morning show. Every weekday, MORNING FOOTY host Susannah Collins along with former U.S. Men’s National Team player Charlie Davies, analyst Nico Cantor and comedian Alexis Guerreros bring their unique voices and fresh perspectives to the latest news and storylines impacting soccer worldwide. As soccer’s new staple show for fans everywhere, MORNING FOOTY delivers a daily dose of razor-sharp insights and laughs with match highlights, compelling analysis, entertaining interviews, updates - from reporter Jenny Chiu and more that is sure to help kick off your day. In addition, the Network will feature live matches, pre- and post-match breakdowns, magazine shows, films from Paramount+’s STORIES FROM THE BEAUTIFUL GAME soccer documentary collection and original programming. The Network’s live matches and re-airs utilize CBS Sports’ collection of top-tier soccer properties, including UEFA club competitions, Serie A, NWSL, Concacaf national team competitions, Barclays Women’s Super League, Campeonato Brasileirão Série A, Scottish Professional Football League, Argentina Liga Profesional de Fútbol and the AFC Champions League, among others. Watch CBS SPORTS GOLAZO NETWORK 24 hours a day, 7 days a week and all 365 days a year.

programme.title: The Billion Dollar Goal
programme.desc: Tracing the evolution of soccer in the United States, from its beginnings as an immigrant's game to the historic moment in 1989 when Paul Caligiuri's unforgettable goal ended a 40-year World Cup qualification drought.
